description: OneNote is a popular note-taking tool that's available online and on many mobile and tablet platforms. By integrating your apps with OneNote, it's easier than ever to create empowering apps on your favorite platforms and reach millions of users worldwide.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: Notifications are sent as POST requests that contain a JSON object.

args.name: token
args.info: Token sent on each message

blocks.name: createPage
blocks.description: Creates a new page in the user's default section and notebook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: content
args.info: Page content

blocks.name: createPageInSection
blocks.description: Creates a new page in the specified section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: content
args.info: Page content

args.name: sectionId
args.info: The id of section where the page is to be created.

blocks.name: createSectionDefaultPage
blocks.description: Creates a new page in the specified section of the user's default notebook. If the section doesn't exist (or was renamed), the API will create the section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: content
args.info: Page content

args.name: sectionName
args.info: The name of the section in the default notebook to create this new page in, if the section does not already exist.

blocks.name: updatePage
blocks.description: Modify page content.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: content
args.info: Page content

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the page.

blocks.name: getAllPages
blocks.description: Gets a collection of pages (metadata) across all notebooks in OneDrive that the user can access.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.

blocks.name: getSectionPages
blocks.description: Gets a collection of pages (metadata) under the specified section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A valid OAuth token provided to the app based on the user credentials and the user having authorized access.

args.name: id
args.info: Section ID.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Boolean. Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.

args.name: pageLevel
args.info: Boolean. Returns the level and order properties of the pages.

blocks.name: getSinglePage
blocks.description: Gets a collection of pages (metadata) under the specified section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Section ID.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: pageLevel
args.info: Boolean. Returns the level and order properties of the pages.

blocks.name: getPageContent
blocks.description: Gets a collection of pages (metadata) under the specified section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Section ID.

args.name: includeIDs
args.info: Boolean. 'true' to include auto-generated element IDs.

args.name: preAuthenticated
args.info: Boolean. 'true' to return URLs that temporarily enable public access to the image resources on the page.'true' to include auto-generated element IDs.

blocks.name: getPagePreview
blocks.description: Gets preview content for a specific page.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Section ID.

blocks.name: deletePage
blocks.description: You can't recover deleted data, so be careful when using this method. Deleting pages using the API deletes them permanently. They are not added to the OneNote Recycle Bin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Section ID.

blocks.name: getAllSections
blocks.description: Gets all sections to which a user has access in all OneNote notebooks that are stored in Microsoft OneDrive. This includes sections in notebooks that are both owned by and shared with the user. You can also retrieve all sections to which the user has access inside a specific notebook or section group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.

blocks.name: getNotebookSections
blocks.description: Gets a collection of sections from the specified notebook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Notebook id.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.

blocks.name: getGroupSections
blocks.description: Gets a collection of sections from the specified section group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: The id of the section group that contains the section.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.

blocks.name: getSingleSection
blocks.description: Gets a specific section inside a OneNote notebook that is stored in Microsoft OneDrive. This can be a section in a notebook that is either owned by or shared with the user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: Section id.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

blocks.name: createSection
blocks.description: Creates a new section in the specified notebook on Microsoft OneDrive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: The id of the notebook where you want to create the section.

args.name: name
args.info: Section name

blocks.name: createGroupSection
blocks.description: Creates a new section in the specified section group on Microsoft OneDrive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: The id of the section group where you want to create the section.

args.name: name
args.info: Section name

blocks.name: renameSection
blocks.description: Renames the specified section.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: id
args.info: The id of the section to update.

args.name: name
args.info: Section name

blocks.name: getSectionGroups
blocks.description: Gets all section groups to which a user has access in all OneNote notebooks that are stored in Microsoft OneDrive. This includes section groups in notebooks that are both owned by and shared with the user. You can also retrieve all section groups to which a user has access inside a specific notebook or section group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The id of page.

args.name: filter
args.info: A Boolean expression for whether to include a particular entry. Example: title eq 'Trip Planning'.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Expression specifying order. Default is lastModifiedTime desc. Example: createdTime.

args.name: select
args.info: Expression specifying the properties to return

args.name: expand
args.info: Expression specifying the navigation properties to return inline.

args.name: top
args.info: Specifies to return only the first n results. Default is 20, maximum is 100.

args.name: skip
args.info: Specifies to skip the first n results, typically used for paging. Example: 5.

args.name: search
args.info: Specifies the term or phrase to search for in the page title, page body, image alt text, and image OCR text.

args.name: count
args.info: Specifies to include the count of the returned collection.
